2 Corinthians ^ 8 ^ 2Co 2:10-11. ^ even as himself also upon his true repentance had forgiven him

2 Corinthians ^ 10 ^ 2Co 2:14-17. ^ and the happy success which God gave to his preaching in all places

2 Corinthians ^ 12 ^ 2Co 3:6-11. ^ Whereupon entering a comparison between the ministers of the law and of the gospel
2 Corinthians ^ 13 ^ 2Co 3:12-18. ^ he proves that his ministry is so far the more excellent as the gospel of life and liberty is more glorious than the law of condemnation
2 Corinthians ^ 14 ^ 2Co 4:1-6. ^ He declares how he has used all sincerity and faithful diligence in preaching the gospel
2 Corinthians ^ 15 ^ 2Co 4:7-11. ^ and how the troubles and persecutions which he daily endured for the same did redound to the praise of Gods power
2 Corinthians ^ 16 ^ 2Co 4:12-15. ^ to the benefit of the church
2 Corinthians ^ 17 ^ 2Co 4:16-18. ^ and to the apostles own eternal glory
2 Corinthians ^ 18 ^ 2Co 5:1-8. ^ That in his assured hope of immortal glory

2 Corinthians ^ 20 ^ 2Co 5:12-13. ^ not that he may herein boast of himself
2 Corinthians ^ 21 ^ 2Co 5:14-17. ^ but as one that having received life from Christ endeavours to live as a new creature to Christ only
2 Corinthians ^ 22 ^ 2Co 5:18-21. ^ and by his ministry of reconciliation to reconcile others also in Christ to God
2 Corinthians ^ 23 ^ 2Co 6:1-2. ^ That he has approved himself a faithful minister of Christ by his exhortations
2 Corinthians ^ 24 ^ 2Co 6:3. ^ and by integrity of life
2 Corinthians ^ 25 ^ 2Co 6:4-9. ^ and by patient enduring all kinds of affliction and disgrace for the gospel
2 Corinthians ^ 26 ^ 2Co 6:10-12. ^ Of which he speaks the more boldly amongst them because his heart is open to them
2 Corinthians ^ 27 ^ 2Co 6:13. ^ and he expects the like affection from them again
2 Corinthians ^ 28 ^ 2Co 6:14-18. ^ exhorting them to flee the society and pollutions of idolaters as being themselves temples of the living God
2 Corinthians ^ 29 ^ 2Co 7:1. ^ He proceeds in exhorting them to purity of life
2 Corinthians ^ 30 ^ 2Co 7:2. ^ and to bear him like affection as he does to them

2 Corinthians ^ 32 ^ 2Co 7:13-16. ^ and of their lovingkindness and obedience toward Titus answerable to his former boastings of them

2 Corinthians ^ 34 ^ 2Co 8:7-8. ^ by commendation of their former forwardness
2 Corinthians ^ 35 ^ 2Co 8:9-13. ^ by the example of Christ
2 Corinthians ^ 36 ^ 2Co 8:14-15. ^ and by the spiritual profit that shall redound to themselves thereby

2 Corinthians ^ 37 ^ 2Co 8:16-24. ^ commending to them the integrity and willingness of Titus and those other brethren who upon his request exhortation and commendation were purposely come to them for this business
2 Corinthians ^ 38 ^ 2Co 9:1-5. ^ He yields the reason why though he knew their forwardness yet he sent Titus and his brethren beforehand
2 Corinthians ^ 39 ^ 2Co 9:6-9. ^ And he proceeds in stirring them up to a bountiful alms as being but a kind of sowing of seed
2 Corinthians ^ 40 ^ 2Co 9:10-12. ^ which shall return a great increase to them
2 Corinthians ^ 41 ^ 2Co 9:13-15. ^ and occasion a great sacrifice of thanksgivings unto God

2 Corinthians ^ 43 ^ 2Co 10:7-11. ^ assuring them that at his coming he will be found as mighty in word as he is now in writing being absent
2 Corinthians ^ 44 ^ 2Co 10:12-18. ^ and withal taxing them for reaching out themselves beyond their compass and vaunting themselves of other mens labours

2 Corinthians ^ 46 ^ 2Co 11:5-6. ^ of his equality with the chief apostles
2 Corinthians ^ 47 ^ 2Co 11:7-12. ^ of his preaching the gospel to them freely and without any charge to them
2 Corinthians ^ 48 ^ 2Co 11:13-22. ^ shewing that he was not inferior to those deceitful workers in any legal prerogative
2 Corinthians ^ 49 ^ 2Co 11:23-33. ^ and in the service of Christ and in all kinds of sufferings for his ministry far superior

2 Corinthians ^ 51 ^ 2Co 12:9-10. ^ yet he rather chooses to glory of his infirmities
2 Corinthians ^ 52 ^ 2Co 12:11-13. ^ blaming them for forcing him to this vain boasting
2 Corinthians ^ 53 ^ 2Co 12:14-19. ^ He promises to come to them again but yet altogether in the affection of a father
2 Corinthians ^ 54 ^ 2Co 12:20-21. ^ although he fears he shall to his grief find many offenders and public disorders there
2 Corinthians ^ 55 ^ 2Co 13:1-4. ^ He threatens severity and the power of his apostleship against obstinate sinners
2 Corinthians ^ 56 ^ 2Co 13:5-6. ^ And advising them to a trial of their faith
2 Corinthians ^ 57 ^ 2Co 13:7-10. ^ and to a reformation of their sins before his coming
2 Corinthians ^ 58 ^ 2Co 13:11-14. ^ he concludes his epistle with a general exhortation and a prayer
